result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Robert Bryar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentences currently serving.

miscConds.notes: -Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or a licensed agency as determined by Probation Agent and follow any treatment recommendations.

-Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 
-Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician.
-Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Jeremy Robert Bryar in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas William Bolz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alex Gelhar in court for Jeremy Robert Bryar. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver filed.
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights and enters N/C plea to Ct. 1.
Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty re: Ct. 1; Ct. 2 - dismissed & read-in.
Statements by ADA Bolz and Atty. Gelhar - jt. agreement.
Court orders sentences W/H, probation 4 years concurrent w/one another but consecutive to any other sentence now serving.
Conditions of probation are as follows:
-defendant to pay costs/supervision fees
-Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
-Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 
-Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961. 
-Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician.
Defendant provided w/Notice of Appeal Rights and Firearm/Voting Restriction.
